text: I never thought I didn't get arrested
for experiencing a tragedy I lost my
daughter and then I was prosecuted for
it
incarcerated shunned shamed sequestered
I should have been she'd never have
happened at the time I was 36 single mom
working at a minimum wage job living in
my family's home to get knocked up
barely being able to take care of myself
now I'm being able to take care of
myself and my son adding another child
to that just was not feasible we were on
the couch one night I said hey mom what
would happen if I tripped and fell on a
boy and got pregnant and she looked at
me and she was real serious and she said
well I think you would need to make
arrangements to find another place to
live I was so ashamed at that point is
when I really knew that I was gonna have
to actually make a decision about her
future
and that's when I decided to give my
baby to some friends I was seven months
along every day whenever she was awake
she would just she would be kicking and
that she just stopped
I started to feel liver pains the night
I went to bed I got up in the middle
light and when she's bathroom and
everything started to come out I mean
everything started to come out she was
beautiful really beautiful but I was
closed how close just complete stillness
packaged up her remains into bed when I
woke up that morning after I was aware
enough to think I drove myself to the
emergency room with the remains in front
passenger seat I came in I said I need
to see someone gave birth last night and
she didn't make it they took the baby
and were able to very quickly determine
that it was a stillbirth
several days later the sheriff got me on
the way home from the hospital arrested
me they put handcuffs on me
they put me in the back of the police
car they said they were arrested me for
concealing birth took me straight to
jail and booked me I thought who am i
arrested for concealing it from my mom
my dad my brothers who it didn't seem to
be that it was treated as a stillbirth
it seemed to be like it was being
treated as murder the trial was a
nightmare this is a very very local
Christian area anti-abortion area I've
had an abortion you know I had abortions
the prosecution used my perfectly legal
medical procedure against me when the
jury came back so fast I just depend
knew they wanted justice they wanted
retribution they wanted their pound of
flesh the jury deliberated four minutes
to convict me of concealing a birth and
sentenced me almost immediately after to
the maximum sentence of Secours I spent
59 days in prison
[Music]
my past medical history had nothing to
do with the charges brought against me
my body my business they're trying to
regulate birth in this country it goes
beyond abortion women's rights are being
threatened it's like a cattle I have
been locked up pretty much in my house
for three years and I have to be under
supervision with my son I just can't I
can't be alone with my son at this time

you
